meanings.definition: The action of improving or enhancing the quality or value of something.
meanings.sent1: The school offers an enrichment program for students to learn new skills.
meanings.sent2: She found great enrichment in volunteering at the local animal shelter.
meanings.sent3: The enrichment of the garden with colorful flowers brought joy to everyone.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was an enrichment to the community, like a ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The music festival was an incredible enrichment of culture and art.

meanings.definition: The process of making something more meaningful or rewarding.
meanings.sent1: Reading books is an important form of mental enrichment.
meanings.sent2: Traveling to new places can provide a lot of personal enrichment.
meanings.sent3: The enrichment of the story with unexpected plot twists kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was an enrichment to the conversation, making it lively.
meanings.sent5: The mentorship program was an invaluable source of career enrichment.

meanings.definition: The act of adding nutrients or other beneficial elements to something.
meanings.sent1: The enrichment of the soil with compost helped the plants grow better.
meanings.sent2: Fish food contains essential nutrients for the enrichment of aquatic life.
meanings.sent3: The enrichment of the soup with extra spices made it taste even better.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an enrichment to the photo, brightening the whole scene.
meanings.sent5: The scientist conducted experiments to study the enrichment of vitamins in food.
